tags: buffy's the one who helped me
summary: One year ago today I was sobbing my eyes out because of Cyrus' storyline. And I realized just how alike me and him were. Because...
body: One year ago today I was sobbing my eyes out because of Cyrus’ storyline. And I realized just how alike me and him were. Because I realized I was pansexual. And when Buffy said “you’ve always been weird but you’re no different.” I knew I was going to be Okay. And I am okay to this day.❤

reblog.comment: One year ago today I was sobbing my eyes out because of Cyrus’ storyline. And I realized just how alike me and him were. Because I realized I was pansexual. And when Buffy said “you’ve always been weird but you’re no different.” I knew I was going to be Okay. And I am okay to this day.❤

And when Buffy said “you’ve always been weird but you’re no different.” I knew I was going to be Okay. And I am okay to this day.❤

And when Buffy said “you’ve always been weird but you’re no different.” I knew I was going to be Okay. And I am okay to this day.❤

blog.name: i-am-beyoutiful
blog.title: My Oh So Crazy Life
blog.description: I love a lot of different things. This blog is a compilation of all of them. Get ready for the craziness that is my brain at work #nerdnation

body:
#31DaysOfAndiMack Day 27

Prompt: How would the characters react if they got lost/stuck in a corn maze?

Oh Cyrus would freak out immediately. He would over react so much. Tj would be looking at him laughing in his head about Cyrus. I think Andi, Buffy and Jonah wouldn’t freak at first but if a long time goes by and they hadn’t made it to the end they would proceed to get more and more concerned. The only one who would have their composure would be a walker and Tj. I would be even more funny if going through a corn maze was on Cyrus’ list. I think once walker and Tj have everyone calmed down they would finally make it through.

summary: The first time I watched Cyrus's coming out scene I was slightly tipsy with some friends in one of my friend's dorm room (you...
body: The first time I watched Cyrus’s coming out scene I was slightly tipsy with some friends in one of my friend’s dorm room (you know, what you do when you’re a college freshman and it’s Friday night) and started crying because there was a gay character on Disney channel and it was gonna help so many young gay kids out there. Here’s to Andi Mack for giving kids the show I wish I had when I was 12 and confused about loving girls.

reblog.comment: The first time I watched Cyrus’s coming out scene I was slightly tipsy with some friends in one of my friend’s dorm room (you know, what you do when you’re a college freshman and it’s Friday night) and started crying because there was a gay character on Disney channel and it was gonna help so many young gay kids out there. Here’s to Andi Mack for giving kids the show I wish I had when I was 12 and confused about loving girls.

im just so damn grateful yall dont even know
summary: happy one year anniversary of the day cyrus came out to buffy
body:
happy one year anniversary of the day cyrus came out to buffy

i just. wow. what a scene.

so many people worked so hard to make it a reality, and i know we’re all so grateful. i remember feeling the happiest i’d felt in a long time when i saw it.

i’d been so scared that terri and disney might have queerbaited us throughout s1, with cyrus acting the same way andi did around jonah and cyrus looking back, but we weren’t.

we weren’t.

thank you, terri minsky, and everyone else that was able to make that scene and many scenes to come happen. thank you, josh, for portraying that fear of being thought of as weird or different so well. thank you, sofia, for playing the unconditionally supportive best friend (and thank you again, terri, for making buffy as supportive as she was).

happy one year anniversary of the day history was made, and thank you for making it.

we weren’t.

thank you, terri minsky, and everyone else that was able to make that scene and many scenes to come happen. thank you, josh, for portraying that fear of being thought of as weird or different so well. thank you, sofia, for playing the unconditionally supportive best friend (and thank you again, terri, for making buffy as supportive as she was).

happy one year anniversary of the day history was made, and thank you for making it.

blog.description: I will go down with my ships. And even as they die in continuity, they will live on in my heart.

summary: I keep seeing posts from people sad about the diminishing height difference between Luke and Josh, and I don’t really get it....
body: I keep seeing posts from people sad about the diminishing height difference between Luke and Josh, and I don’t really get it. Like, the height difference is the least important aspect to Tyrus. It’s that TJ genuinely seems driven to be a better person because of Cy, and Cy’s willingness to break out of his comfort zone because of TJ. They both make each other MORE than they are without the other. And that’s just magic to me.

reblog.comment: I keep seeing posts from people sad about the diminishing height difference between Luke and Josh, and I don’t really get it. They both make each other MORE than they are without the other. And that’s just magic to me.

title: A year ago today,
body:
I was sitting on the floor in my dad’s apartment, the only lighting in the room a flourescent light behind me; I figured my dad must have forgotten to turn it off before he went to bed.

I was passively watching the episode of Andi Mack that had come on when I wasn’t paying attention, but was mostly scrolling through Instagram, envious of the various LGBTQ+ activists that littered my feed. I knew there was something familiar about the episode in front of me, but it wasn’t until I found myself watching Cyrus and Buffy sit across from one another in the Spoon that I realized-this was it.

I was what feels like a thousand years younger than I am now- struggling with mental illness, being way too hard on myself in school, sleeping very very little, and having somehow managed to develop romantic feelings for girls, not boys. At that point, I was constantly terrified. Terrified of screwing up, of failing at anything or everything, terrified of being gay. I think some part of me still is.

But, somehow, through all of that, I managed to get my brain to stop screaming at me long enough to watch Cyrus Goodman come out to Buffy Driscoll.

I wasn’t quite sure how long I cried for, but I knew it was long after the scene ended when I finally sniffled, wiped my eyes, and stood up. 

That was the first day in my entire life that I’d felt seen, represented-and even that was only in the form of a male character. Sure, there were LGBT characters in some of my favorite shows. But they were always adults, never people who were really just kids like me.

Watching that episode of Andi Mack reminded me that my identity, my attraction, my life, aren’t mature content. 

I never forgot that.

body:
Coming out chain?

Because of this show, this character, and his actor. I decided to make a coming out chain, I’ve seen some of y'all’s stories thought this be nice to do! Feel free to add on.

My name is Lucas, I am a transgender gay man. And thanks to this show I learned to love myself no matter what!
